content.description: This route climbs the Arete west of the other climbs. Protect with nuts or small cams. 2 bold anchor at the top.
content.location: West of the the other climbs on Platypus Rock.

content.description:
Likely the easiest of the bolted routes on the Platypus, but the crux is not trivial, particularly if you don't know where the good holds are.

Climb 3 bolts off 5.7 jugs on steep, slightly mossy rock. The tricky crux moves guard the anchor, but are very well protected by the third bolt, so go for it! It may be easiest to mantle and top out and then clip the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor. Rap rings recently added to this route. (7/19/16 is when I saw them)
content.location: The only bolted route on the South Face (see Platypus area description).

content.description: To the right of Howling Iguana, up the face to the right of the small cracks in the middle of Howling Iguana.
content.protection: Various top ropes from anchors, including Howling Iguana.
content.location: To the left of the right arete on the West Face of Platypus

content.description:
This route has some good climbing on it, but the fact that its crux is before you clip the first bolt certainly detracts from its quality.

Make puzzling moves up to the first bolt, using any form of trickery you can muster. Clip the first bolt and head up easier, but still interesting, terrain past two more bolts to the anchors.

I thought the bottom of this route was particularly stout for the grade. "Plat-A-Pussy" has a harder crux but is less sustained than its neighbor, "Moss Man".
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor. To rappel, use the "Moss Man" anchors.
content.location: The left of the two routes on the West Face (see Platypus area description)

content.description:
Interesting moves using small pockets, sidepulls and sloping dishes lead up to some better holds at the second bolt. At this point you're through the crux, but the route remains tricky all the way to the anchors.

Fun, technical climbing. Felt hard for the grade to me.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with quicklinks for rappel
content.location: The right of the bolted routes on the West Face (see Area description)

content.description: First half is much more challenging than the second half. Some tricky little side pulls and thin feet for the first section lead to larger holds on lower angle ground.
content.protection: Three quickdraws to two bolt anchor. Decent rap rings nearby.
content.location:
Same start as Al Hussein. Head to the right of the arete, rather than shifting left. Great beta images on how to find the route here:

bayareaclimbers.com/ssshady…

content.description: Slabby toprope route to the right of Jellyfish. Crux is fairly early on, climbing gets easier near the top.
content.protection: Top rope from the same anchor as Jellyfish. Cannot be led
content.location: The rightmost route on the north face of Platypus

content.description:
The first 2 bolts of climbing consists of a delicate and elegant lie-backing and smearing up a steep slab. Reach a great rest just before the third bolt, and reach the anchors after some bizarre, harder-than -they-look moves on and just to the right of the arete feature.

I thought this was best route that I tried at the crag (my partner agreed). It isn't that much harder than the other 5.10s on the Platypus (though it is harder), and is well protected where it is difficult, so go for it!
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor. Use the "Moss Man" anchors if you need to rappel.
content.location: The left of the two routes on the North Face. See Platypus area description.
